required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors for Occurrence of the Middle Cerebral Artery Aneurysm
clinical_study.official_title: Independent Risk Factors for the Middle Cerebral Artery Aneurysm: a Case-control Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the research was to evaluate independent risk factors for the presence of middle cerebral artery aneurysm. Hemodynamic factors play the most important role in rupture aneurysm according hemodynamic theory. Geometry of division can influence flow blood. Division of the middle cerebral artery with or without aneurysm were analized using Mimisc software.

detailed_description.textblock:
CTA is performed in patients suffering from minor symptoms like headache or vertigo or for screening without obvious medical indications after without change CT.
After obtaining written informed consenst, all the participants completed a survey on their age, gender, body height and weight, cigarette smoking status and comorbidities.
MCA is divided into frontal and temporal branch. Division of the middle cerebral artery with or without aneurysm were analized using Mimisc software. CTA was imported in MIMISC as 3 D images. Morfological parameters were analized bifurcation angles, diameter, tortuosity, cross- sectional area and circumference branch and were compared each other.

primary_outcome.description: Shape of bifurcation MCA can cause development of the aneurysm because of changes of hemodynamics parameters. Angles between branches are larger in division MCA with aneurysm compare in MCA without. Between frontal and temporal branches exists bigger difference of diamaters in MCA with aneurysm. Geometry bifurcation can important way to decide about distribution blood flow in apex of division.

arm_group.description: Patients , who had midle cerebral artery aneurysm in screening CTA.
Patients , who had no midle cerebral artery aneurysm in screening CTA.

intervention.description: CTA was performed to evaluate present changes in cerebral arteries.

study_pop.textblock: Population patients suffered from minor symptoms such as headache or vertigo and sreening without obvious medical indication.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-performance CTA
Exclusion Criteria:
- age <18 or >75
- pregnancy
- pathologies of central nervous system
- connective tissue diseases
- severe systemic disorders
- history of ischemic stroke, intracerebral hemorrhage, SAH

results_reference.citation: Ingebrigtsen T, Morgan MK, Faulder K, Ingebrigtsen L, Sparr T, Schirmer H. Bifurcation geometry and the presence of cerebral artery aneurysms. J Neurosurg. 2004 Jul;101(1):108-13.

Bor AS, Velthuis BK, Majoie CB, Rinkel GJ. Configuration of intracranial arteries and development of aneurysms: a follow-up study. Neurology. 2008 Feb 26;70(9):700-5. doi: 10.1212/01.wnl.0000302176.03551.35.
Rossitti S, Löfgren J. Vascular dimensions of the cerebral arteries follow the principle of minimum work. Stroke. 1993 Mar;24(3):371-7.
Rossitti S. Shear stress in cerebral arteries carrying saccular aneurysms. A preliminary study. Acta Radiol. 1998 Nov;39(6):711-7.

Kaspera W, Ładziński P, Larysz P, Hebda A, Ptaszkiewicz K, Kopera M, Larysz D. Morphological, hemodynamic, and clinical independent risk factors for anterior communicating artery aneurysms. Stroke. 2014 Oct;45(10):2906-11. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.114.006055. Epub 2014 Aug 28.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Department of Neurosurgery, Regional Hospital no 5 in Sosnowiec
